---- ---                          PLOT OUTLINE :                   - ---   -----
 ------- -----                                                ------------------
                                                                             --
In the city of Ankh Morpork, most important city on the Discworld (in the 
opinion of the Morporkians, and what other opinion is worth considering?) it is 
Hogswatch - a midwinter festival of celebration and gift-giving which might 
remind you of quite another holiday on another world entirely. The Hogfather - a
jolly fat man, dressed in red - is distributing presents from his flying sleigh 
and all the children wait to hear trotter-beats on the roof. But this Hogswatch,
they may have to wait quite a while... Someone, or something, wants the 
Hogfather out of the way. And if you&#039;re an anthropomorphic personification, you 
can&#039;t be helped by humans - but perhaps a, shall we say &#039;colleague&#039;, could 
assist. And so Death (voiced by Ian Richardson), his manservant Albert (Sir 
David Jason) and his granddaughter (don&#039;t ask) Susan (Michelle Dockery) set out 
to save the day, er, night. But while they&#039;re doing that, the redoubtable Mr 
Teatime (Mark Warren) of the Guild of Assassins and his team which includes the 
inept student wizard Mr Sideney (Nigel Planer) and the man-mountain Banjo 
(Stephen Marcus) set in motion a devious plan which means much, much more than 
just the end of Hogswatch...
